subject: Sales
title: The Price Objection Decoded
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on The Price Objection Decoded.

hook.text: 'Too expensive' is the most common objection in all of sales. It's also the least honest one.

buildup.text: Price objections usually mask deeper worries: lack of trust, unclear value, or simply bad timing.

discovery.text: When buyers say 'too expensive' they mean 'I don't yet see enough value to justify this price.'

twist.text: Discounting is the worst response. It trains objection behavior and confirms the price was inflated.

climax.text: Reframe value instead. Show clear ROI, reduce perceived risk, or break costs into smaller amounts.

punchline.text: Price isn't the problem. Perceived value is.

quiz.question: What does 'too expensive' usually really mean?
options: The product costs too much to make
The buyer doesn't see enough value yet
